Madinah Arabic Course B1 L10 P2
lesson on attached pronouns AND asmaul khamsa

words.w:
In this lesson we learn:

1. The possessive pronoun:
kitab-u-ka (your book). Here "your" is for masculine singular
These pronouns are not full-fledged words. They are like suffixes attached to the nouns.

As we have seen "your book" is كِتَابُكَ and "his book" is كِتَابُهُ. The word for "father" is أَبٌ and for "brother" is أَخٌ. "Your brother" is أَخُوكَ (akhuu-ka) and not أَخُكَ (akhuka)

An extra waw و has to be added between the mudaf and the mudaf ilaihi. In the same way "his father" is not أَبُهُ (abuhu) but أَبُوهُ (abuuhu)

"My father" and "my brother" have no extra waw, e.g. أَخِي،  أَبِي 

The nouns which take this extra waw when they are mudaf are four words. You have learn two, and you will learn the other two in future أنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ
